title: COVID-19 Vaccine Information : Data & Resources : South Heartland District Health Department
cleaned_text: COVID-19 Vaccine Information See below for COVID-19 Vaccines in South Heartland District: If you are homebound or have a disability that makes if difficult to get a COVID-19 vaccination, please call our office. A nurse will return your call and make sure you have access to a COVID vaccination. Para obtener ayuda para encontrar una Sarmiento al Departamento de Salud del Distrito de South Heartland, al 402-469-4482 [FDA News Release: COVID-19 Changes to Simplify Use of Bivalent Vaccines - April 18, 2023](https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/coronavirus-covid-19-update-fda-authorizes-changes-simplify-use-bivalent-mrna-covid-19-vaccines) For Children's vaccine locations and schedule, scroll towards the bottom of this page Adult \ Adolescent Vaccine Schedule 27||12:00pm- 3:00pm||Walk-In Clinic, No Appt Needed (Masks Required)||402-462-6211||SHDHD, 606 North |South North Department||Pfizer Hours||8:30am-11:30am 1-4:30pm 8:30am-11:30am Walk-In Patients||402-834-2438||738 West 3rd, Hastings| |Quality |Superior Family Medical||Pfizer Pediatric Ages 5-11||By 11th, Pharmacy||Moderna 7+||Daily||9:30am- 4:30pm||Appt Only By App Or Website||402-463-4554||705 North Burlington Hastings| COVID Vaccines Information COVID-19 Vaccine Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) Fact Sheets for Recipients and Caregivers COVID-19 Updates, - [Biweekly COVID-19 Updates | Global Center for Health Security | University of Nebraska Medical Center (unmc.edu)](https://www.unmc.edu/healthsecurity/health-emergencies/covid19-updates.html) Dr. James Lawler, UNMC's Global Center for Health Security: Short presentations on current COVID topics, including information on the COVID vaccines
